dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Alright, so, uh, you know how we always talk about emerging tech? Well, 3D printing is, like, seriously having a moment right now when it comes to funding.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Alright, so, uh, you know how we always talk about emerging tech? Well, 3D printing is, like, seriously having a moment right now when it comes to funding.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, totally. I mean, the numbers are just blowing up. PitchBook says 3D printing companies have already attracted $400 million in venture funding just *this year*.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, totally. I mean, the numbers are just blowing up. PitchBook says 3D printing companies have already attracted four hundred million dollars in venture funding just this year.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: So far this year, 3-D printing companies have attracted $400 million in venture funding, half the $800 million they had garnered in the entirety of last year, and surpassing the $300 million they'd attracted the year before that, according to the PitchBook analysis.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: [interrupts] Which is crazy, right? Because that's, uh, half of what they got for the *entirety* of last year. And last year was $800 million!
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Which is crazy, right? Because that's, uh, half of what they got for the entirety of last year. And last year was eight hundred million dollars!
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: So far this year, 3-D printing companies have attracted $400 million in venture funding, half the $800 million they had garnered in the entirety of last year...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, and get this: it's already surpassed the $300 million they pulled in the year before that. If this keeps up, we're looking at over a billion dollars for the first time in five years.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, and get this: it's already surpassed the three hundred million dollars they pulled in the year before that. If this keeps up, we're looking at over a billion dollars for the first time in five years.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: ...and surpassing the $300 million they'd attracted the year before that, according to the PitchBook analysis. If deal flow continued at that rate, it would cross the billion-dollar mark for the first time in five years, even before accounting for the Carbon deal.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: A billion! For 3D printing! That's, um, huge, especially when you think about how little it was back in 2014, like, just $100 million.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: A billion! For 3D printing! That's, um, huge, especially when you think about how little it was back in twenty fourteen, like, just one hundred million dollars.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In 2014, for example, 3-D printing companies attracted just $100 million in VC funding, according to the PitchBook analysis.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, absolutely. While it's, like, still a fraction of what healthcare or software gets, it's a massive bump for 3D printing. It's really gaining traction, especially in the industrial sector.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, absolutely. While it's, like, still a fraction of what healthcare or software gets, it's a massive bump for 3D printing. It's really gaining traction, especially in the industrial sector.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: While those dollars are a pittance compared to the funding numbers for healthcare or software companies, they represent a big bump up for 3-D printing, which has been gaining adoption in the industrial sector and has spawned hundreds of new startups.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: And the big, big news, of course, is Carbon. The 3D printing unicorn. They're reportedly raising another $300 million.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And the big, big news, of course, is Carbon. The 3D printing unicorn. They're reportedly raising another three hundred million dollars.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: That's the case even before accounting for the coming $300 million fundraise from 3-D printing unicorn Carbon, which was first reported by PitchBook on Thursday.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, I mean, that would be the largest deal in five years for the industry! They already had a $200 million deal back in 2018. This new round could push their valuation to, like, $2.5 billion.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, I mean, that would be the largest deal in five years for the industry! They already had a two hundred million dollar deal back in twenty eighteen. This new round could push their valuation to, like, two point five billion dollars.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Carbon's $300 million fundraise would be the largest deal of the past five years among 3-D printing companies, according to the PitchBook analysis, surpassing the same firm's earlier $200 million deal in February 2018. The company is currently valued at $1.7 billion, and could be worth as much as $2.5 billion after the new funding.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: So, what, uh, makes Carbon so appealing, do you think? I know they're huge on those Adidas shoes.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, what, uh, makes Carbon so appealing, do you think? I know they're huge on those Adidas shoes.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Carbon is best known for its partnership with Adidas, with whom it is partnering on midsoles for the German sportswear giants Futurecraft 4D running shoes.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, definitely the Adidas partnership. The Futurecraft 4D running shoes, with those iconic 3D-printed midsoles. That's, like, a huge public win for them.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, definitely the Adidas partnership. The Futurecraft 4D running shoes, with those iconic 3D-printed midsoles. That's, like, a huge public win for them.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Carbon is best known for its partnership with Adidas, with whom it is partnering on midsoles for the German sportswear giants Futurecraft 4D running shoes.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: But it's not just Carbon dominating, right? We've seen other big deals happen just in the first few months of this year.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But it's not just Carbon dominating, right? We've seen other big deals happen just in the first few months of this year.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Three of the top 10 deals of the past five years have occurred in the first few months of this year, according to the PitchBook analysis...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Absolutely. Desktop Metal, for example, raised a massive $160 million. And Markforged, they pulled in another $82 million.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Absolutely. Desktop Metal, for example, raised a massive one hundred sixty million dollars. And Markforged, they pulled in another eighty two million dollars.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Metal 3-D printer maker Desktop Metal raised $160 million, reaching a valuation of $1.5 billion; Markforged, which makes 3-D printers for carbon and metal, raised $82 million, hitting a valuation of $820 million...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: And then there's Fast Radius, a 3D printing service provider, they brought in almost 50 million bucks.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And then there's Fast Radius, a 3D printing service provider, they brought in almost fifty million bucks.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: ...and 3-D printing service provider Fast Radius brought in $48 million, reaching a valuation of $400 million.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, so it's, like, across the board. You've got printers, materials, services â€“ the whole ecosystem is really starting to boom.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, so it's, like, across the board. You've got printers, materials, services - the whole ecosystem is really starting to boom.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Three of the top 10 deals of the past five years have occurred in the first few months of this year, according to the PitchBook analysis: Metal 3-D printer maker Desktop Metal raised $160 million... Markforged, which makes 3-D printers for carbon and metal, raised $82 million... and 3-D printing service provider Fast Radius brought in $48 million...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: So this isn't just a flash in the pan. It sounds like 3D printing is finally, um, really hitting its stride.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So this isn't just a flash in the pan. It sounds like 3D printing is finally, um, really hitting its stride.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: For sure. I mean, the numbers really speak for themselves. It's a super exciting space to watch right now.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: For sure. I mean, the numbers really speak for themselves. It's a super exciting space to watch right now.
